Upgrades if you care more about raid:

Weapon: Primal Molten Spellblade

Embellishment: Potion Absorption Inhibitor

Non-tier slot piece for second and third craft:

Belt, boots, cape, or rings

Embellishment: Potion Absorption Inhibitor

Optional third embellishment: Alchemical Flavor Pocket (doesn't take up any embellishment slots)

Missives:

Healing focus: Draconic Missive of the Feverflare [Mastery + Haste]

Damage focus: Draconic Missive of the Aurora [Versatility + Haste]

Reason for this embellishment:

Potion of Chilled Clarity: Reduces the mana cost of all spells by 100% but also increases cast time by 40% for 15 seconds. (5 Min Cooldown)
The Potion Absorption Inhibitor embellishments stack, giving you 100% increased duration of potions.


Upgrades if you care more about M+:

Neck: Elemental Lariat
Weapon or non-tier slot piece for second and third craft:

Dagger, belt, boots, cape, or rings

Embellishment: Magazine of Healing Darts

Optional third embellishment: Alchemical Flavor Pocket (doesn't take up any embellishment slots)

Missives:

Healing focus: Draconic Missive of the Feverflare [Mastery + Haste]

Damage focus: Draconic Missive of the Aurora [Versatility + Haste]

Reason for Elemental Lariat:

It has its own powerful embellishment which procs a stat depending on which gems you wear.

First socket: Fierce Illimited Diamond
The second and third socket depend on your focus (damage or healing). You'll want split gems because they give more overall stats, and you want to match the gems to control which stat procs (the smaller of the split).

I'm assuming you'll want haste to proc, so while it will be the smaller stat of the gems, you'll get roughly 550 when it procs.
Healing focus: Keen Neltharite [70 mastery + 33 haste]
Damage focus: Energized Malygite [70 versatility + 33 haste]

Use Tiered Medallion Setting to add the sockets. Rank 2 for the second slot, and rank 3 for the third.


Currently, you can have 3 pieces of crafted gear with a max of 418 ilvl each.

Primal Infusion (405 item level): 10 Primal Focus + 100 Primal Chaos

Drops from keys 11 to 15.

Concentrated Primal Infusion (418 item level): 10 Concentrated Primal Focus + 150 Primal Chaos

Drops from keys 16+.

Equipment have ranks, so for max item level, you need a personal crafter who can craft at rank 5 (your guild might have them)

After deciding your crafted slots, use valor to target your weakest non-tier slots (unless you have tier from M+ and it's upgradable).
If you did craft the dagger, offhands are extremely cheap to upgrade.
